featured.text: The 10 bells vary in size, each 23 a name.
Mounted in the two tall towers of the cathedral, Notre-Dame’s bells have been ringing for over 800 years.
Over centuries, the bells have become a 26 part of life in Paris, where they are known as “the cathedral’s voice.”
On his way to the dump, the bell rang.
This particular bell, ringing in F sharp, is considered one of the most harmonically beautiful in Europe.

other.text: Located at the heart of Paris, this medieval cathedral is 21 for its intricate architecture, stunning stained glass windows, and, above all, its bells.
In fact, there is documented 22 to the ringing of bells even before the cathedral’s construction was completed, dating as far back as the 12th century.
The sounds of Notre-Dame bells once again filled the air in Paris, and will be heard for generations to come.
But due to their poor acoustic quality, all of the bells were replaced in 2013—except for Emmanuel, which 25 its renowned, excellent sound.
However, after the devastating fire that damaged the cathedral in 2019, the bells fell 29 .
The melted bells were recast in the late 19th century.

definition.zh_def: 鈴，通常用於發出聲音的圓形物體，常見於教堂、學校或作為警報裝置。
definition.en_def: A hollow metallic object that makes a ringing sound when struck, often used for signaling or decoration.
definition.example: The school bell rang, signaling the end of the class.
